meanings.definition: Engaging in corrupt or dishonest behavior, especially in politics.
meanings.sent1: The boodling politician was caught accepting bribes.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to be boodling in any situation.
meanings.sent3: The boodling official thought they could get away with their deceit.
meanings.sent4: The boodling scheme unraveled when evidence was uncovered.
meanings.sent5: The town was shocked by the boodling behavior of its mayor.

meanings.definition: To engage in petty or dishonest behavior for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: She was boodling by taking office supplies for her own use.
meanings.sent2: He was known for boodling by manipulating the system for profit.
meanings.sent3: The children were boodling by sneaking extra cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist was boodling unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The employee was fired for boodling on company time.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in corrupt practices or bribery.
meanings.sent1: The investigation revealed a web of boodling within the company.
meanings.sent2: Boodling is a serious offense that can lead to legal consequences.
meanings.sent3: The scandal exposed the widespread boodling among high-ranking officials.
meanings.sent4: The history of politics is rife with examples of boodling for power.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the dark world of political boodling.
